relation: I was in Disney World where the imagination of it rubbed off on me a bit...
Inspired by both Avatar: The Last Airbender, and Spirited Away's 'Dragon Boy' track.
Made from tape, cardboard, and colored with prisma markers/pencils. :) Usable for Gen 3 iPod Nanos.

There's a bit of a story behind this entry, so be patient with me! :) This may not be as weird and slightly creepy as Draca's entry (Which is so amazing, by the way! XD) but it is a bit... unusual. I guess? So over the past week I visited the Kennedy Space Center in Florida for the first time. Now, before you jump to conclusions, I was completely facinated and it really was a treat and I live at the tip of the East Coast so I never get to see awesome stuff like this. While looking in some of the exhibits, I noticed the massive Saturn V (Five) Rocket, which had the power to bring things to orbit, and was the rocket used to launch all of the Apollo missions as well as the Space Shuttle missions. Being a MOTHER nerd, I thought of the 'Five can Ladder' quote, and kind of connected it to the Saturn Five rocket. I had a notebook in my paper, so over lunch, I sketched this out and went back to the exhibit in in EarthBound's honor, I took my drawing's photo next to a display of the rocket. :) So look at it this way, there was a MOTHER fan being a MOTHER fan in a space center! I also recreated a Space Shuttle and went even more EarthBoundy on it and renamed it 'Melody' and put 'Eagleland' in place of the 'United States' logo. I also mixed up the American flag a little and let's just say it's the Eagleland flag. I tried to make each Saturn look a little different as well! I used colored pencil on the shuttle, the Saturns, the plume of flame, and the planet as well. The background was done with markers. HERE IS THE PHOTO!: http://i52.tinypic.com/2mn2ko0.jpg
